moves.1. d4: Queen's pawn opening.I play because it suits my style.
moves.1... d5: More popular is 1...Nf6,but this move is also good and I play this myself as Black.
moves.3. Nf3 Nf6 4. e3: I prefer to handle the QGA this way as White
moves.4... b5: ?!Black holds on to the pawn,but this gives white a lead in development.
moves.5. a4 c6: better than 5...a6? 6.axb5 and 6...axb5?? hangs the rook after 7.Rxa8
moves.6. axb5 cxb5 7. b3: The logical follow-up to 6.axb5.White wins the pawn back.
moves.7... cxb3 8. Bxb5+ Bd7 9. Qxb3: I was thinking of 9.Bxd7+ but this helps Black in development.
moves.9... Bxb5 10. Qxb5+ Nbd7 11. Ne5: I play a line that my friend and teammate suenteuspo147 played on here a while ago.I think this might be best.
moves.12... Bxa3 13. Nxa3: The knight makes it way to help his comrade on e5 via c4.
moves.13... O-O 14. Nac4: White has a small,but enduring advantage.
moves.14... Nxe5 15. Nxe5 Nd5: Black establishes and outpost on d5 to counter the knight on e5,but it doesn't do as much as the opposing knight on e5.
moves.16. O-O f6 17. Nd7: The knight now takes a journey to the outpost on c5.
moves.17... Rf7 18. Nc5: Now,from c5 the knight aims at the weak pawn on e6.It becomes even weaker if it moves forward.
?!A sly trap.22.Rxc3?? Rb1+ leads to mate.Luckily I anticipated this ahead of time and realized Black would lose a pawn.
moves.22. Kf1: Now White's king has an escape route via e2.Now it can head toward the center
moves.23. Nxe6: !Removing the defender of the knight on e6.
moves.23... Rxe6 24. Rxd5 Re7 25. Rdc5: White doubles rooks on the c-file.It takes technique to win the endgame.
moves.28... Ke6 29. Ke2 Kd5 30. Kd3: White has a more favorable endgame a pawn up then some other endgames.Black's passed pawn is doing nothing and the Black rook is stuck along the 7th rank.
moves.31... Kb5 32. Rb1+ Kc6 33. d5+ Kc5 34. R: White's position has improved even more!
moves.35... Ke5: I think 35...Kd7 is a better try.
moves.37. g3 g4: only defense if 38.f4+ gxf3 en passant
moves.38. h3: hoping to lure the pawn away.
moves.39. hxg4 hxg4 40. Rc1: !? a odd move.I hope to keep my position more flexible
moves.40... f5: hoping to win the e4 pawn.
moves.41. Rc4: 41.exf5?! 41...Kxf5+or 41...Kxd5+ and White may not win the endgame.
moves.42... Kxf5 43. Rf4+: A good followup.White cuts off Black's king.
moves.44. Kd4: The white king has way better king position than his counterpart on g5.
moves.44... a5 45. Kc5: ready to push the d-pawn and defending against 45...a4.
moves.45... a4: ? Black does it anyway.Although he is already lost.
